body_html:
@bc-lee If you have a system that has a GPU, you can install the GPU tensorflow version, but only run your code on CPU. GPU pip wheel file will still allow you to run your graph on CPU.
You can then run another process, start another process, which runs your code on GPU. But to be able to do that, you have to have a machine with GPU, with CUDA and CuDNN installed.
I do not see the direct relation of the use case you described to being able to install a TF GPU pip package on a machine with no GPU.
If you were asking a TF package that came with all GPU drivers, CUDA and CuDNN, that is not possible due to different constraints in the licenses of all these software.
